titleStmt.title: Thomas M. Freeman et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9017

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To the Governor of Ky James F. Robinson, At the July term of the Anderson Circuit Court held in 1863

your petitioner Henry Gee was fined the sum of fifty dollars for the offense of Keeping a tipling house. The circumstances were of such a mitigating nature under which he was fined that he offers the following names who were jurors that tried the case, and on hearing prays that your executive clemency maybe extended towards him and the fine be remited.

Jury.
Tho. M. Freeman
J C Betterworth
O, C, Egbert
E. Yeates
John Mcmichael
T D Rake
J J Carter
George Searcy
E. N. Berryman
Wm M. Neal
P. A. Spear
B. Roach
I certify that the above names are the Jury that tried the case in the petition mentioned

C H Fenwick C A C C
Names of the Jury

J. S. Littlepage Jr
Lawrenceburg
Ky
